title: As400/Mainframe Administrator
tagsAndSkills: Configuration,Python,Mainframe Support,AS400 Admin,AS400,Encryption,L2 Support,Security Administration
jobDescription:
Required Immediate Joiner or Max 30 day's notice period

Job Description

We are looking for an AS400/Mainframe Administrator who will be responsible for the administration, maintenance, and security of our AS400/Mainframe systems

Skill / Qualifications

  • Bachelors degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field.
  • 6+ years of experience in AS400/Mainframe administration and security and Mainframe Support.
  • Strong knowledge of AS400/Mainframe architecture and operating systems.
  • Experience with security practices, including access control, encryption, and data protection.
  • Familiarity with regulatory compliance standards (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to respond quickly to security incidents.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to train and support users.
  • Experience with security audit tools and intrusion detection systems.

Job Responsibilities

System Administration:

  • Manage and maintain AS400/Mainframe systems, ensuring high availability and performance.
  • Perform regular system backups, patches, and updates.
  • Create, modify, and delete user profiles and manage permissions and roles.
  • Schedule and manage batch jobs and job queues to ensure efficient system operation.

Security Management:

  • Implement and maintain robust access control policies to protect sensitive data.
  • Conduct regular security audits and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA).
  • Respond to security incidents, investigate breaches, and implement corrective actions.
  • Monitor system logs and intrusion detection systems for unauthorized access and anomalies.

Data Protection:

  • Ensure the encryption of sensitive data both at rest and in transit.
  • Implement data masking techniques in non-production environments to protect sensitive information.

System Monitoring and Maintenance:

  • Collect and analyze system logs to identify and address potential security issues.
  • Monitor system performance and take proactive measures to ensure optimal operation.
  • Develop and maintain disaster recovery plans and conduct regular tests to ensure readiness.

User Training and Support:

  • Provide training and support to users on security best practices and system usage.
  • Develop and update documentation related to system administration and security protocols.

Benefits

Competitive Market Rate (Depending on Experience)
